page.title: 14HEVER CASTLE
page.content: You can visit Anne Boleyn's childhood home, the Italian lake and gardens or enjoy the exhibition of costumes from the period of{Henry VIII and his six wives. The castle was built at hte end of the thirteenth century as a fortified farm surrounded by a moat.A dwelling house was added, with the fortification provided some 200 years later. In 1506 the estate was inherited by Sir Thomas Bullen, father of Anne Boleyn. On his death, it was acquired by Henry VIII who granted it to Anne of Cleves in 1540. In 1903 the castle was bought by William Waldorf Astor who restored and redecorated it throughout. He built an adjoining village in Tudor style cottages and designed the lake and the Italian Gardens.
